verses.text: Against Moab thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts , the God of Israel ; Woe unto Nebo ! for it is spoiled : Kiriathaim is confounded \add and\add* taken : Misgab is confounded and dismayed.\f + \fr 48.1 \ft Misgab: or, the high place\f*

\add There shall be\add* no more praise of Moab : in Heshbon they have devised evil against it; come , and let us cut it off from \add being\add* a nation. Also thou shalt be cut down , O Madmen ; the sword shall pursue thee.\f + \fr 48.2 \ft be cut…: or, be brought to silence\f*\f + \fr 48.2 \ft pursue…: Heb. go after thee\f*
A voice of crying \add shall be\add* from Horonaim , spoiling and great destruction.
Moab is destroyed ; her little ones have caused a cry to be heard.
For in the going up of Luhith continual weeping shall go up ; for in the going down of Horonaim the enemies have heard a cry of destruction.\f + \fr 48.5 \ft continual…: Heb. weeping with weeping\f*
Flee , save your lives , and be like the heath in the wilderness.\f + \fr 48.6 \ft the heath: or, a naked tree\f* \p
¶ For because thou hast trusted in thy works and in thy treasures , thou shalt also be taken : and Chemosh shall go forth into captivity \add with\add* his priests and his princes together.
And the spoiler shall come upon every city , and no city shall escape : the valley also shall perish , and the plain shall be destroyed , as the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath spoken.
Give wings unto Moab , that it may flee and get away : for the cities thereof shall be desolate , without any to dwell therein.

Cursed \add be\add* he that doeth the work of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* deceitfully , and cursed \add be\add* he that keepeth back his sword from blood.\f + \fr 48.10 \ft deceitfully: or, negligently\f* \p

¶ Moab hath been at ease from his youth , and he hath settled on his lees , and hath not been emptied from vessel to vessel , neither hath he gone into captivity : therefore his taste remained in him, and his scent is not changed.\f + \fr 48.11 \ft remained: Heb. stood\f*

Therefore, behold, the days come , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, that I will send unto him wanderers , that shall cause him to wander , and shall empty his vessels , and break their bottles.
And Moab shall be ashamed of Chemosh , as the house of Israel was ashamed of Beth-el their confidence. \p
¶ How say ye, We \add are\add* mighty and strong men for the war ?

Moab is spoiled , and gone up \add out of\add* her cities , and his chosen young men are gone down to the slaughter , saith the King , whose name \add is\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts.\f + \fr 48.15 \ft his…: Heb. the choice of\f*
The calamity of Moab \add is\add* near to come , and his affliction hasteth fast.
All ye that are about him, bemoan him; and all ye that know his name , say , How is the strong staff broken , \add and\add* the beautiful rod !
Thou daughter that dost inhabit Dibon , come down from \add thy\add* glory , and sit in thirst ; for the spoiler of Moab shall come upon thee, \add and\add* he shall destroy thy strong holds.
O inhabitant of Aroer , stand by the way , and espy ; ask him that fleeth , and her that escapeth , \add and\add* say , What is done ?\f + \fr 48.19 \ft inhabitant: Heb. inhabitress\f*
Moab is confounded ; for it is broken down : howl and cry ; tell ye it in Arnon , that Moab is spoiled ,
And judgment is come upon the plain country ; upon Holon , and upon Jahazah , and upon Mephaath ,
And upon Dibon , and upon Nebo , and upon Beth-diblathaim ,
And upon Kiriathaim , and upon Beth-gamul , and upon Beth-meon ,
And upon Kerioth , and upon Bozrah , and upon all the cities of the land of Moab , far or near.
The horn of Moab is cut off , and his arm is broken , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*. \p
¶ Make ye him drunken : for he magnified \add himself\add* against the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: Moab also shall wallow in his vomit , and he also shall be in derision.
For was not Israel a derision unto thee? was he found among thieves ? for since thou spakest of him, thou skippedst for joy.\f + \fr 48.27 \ft skippedst…: or, movedst thyself\f*
O ye that dwell in Moab , leave the cities , and dwell in the rock , and be like the dove \add that\add* maketh her nest in the sides of the hole’s mouth.
We have heard the pride of Moab , (he is exceeding proud ) his loftiness , and his arrogancy , and his pride , and the haughtiness of his heart.

I know his wrath , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; but \add it shall\add* not \add be\add* so; his lies shall not so effect \add it\add*.\f + \fr 48.30 \ft his lies…: or, those on whom he stayeth (Heb. his bars) do not right\f*
Therefore will I howl for Moab , and I will cry out for all Moab ; \add mine heart\add* shall mourn for the men of Kir-heres.

O vine of Sibmah , I will weep for thee with the weeping of Jazer : thy plants are gone over the sea , they reach \add even\add* to the sea of Jazer : the spoiler is fallen upon thy summer fruits and upon thy vintage.

And joy and gladness is taken from the plentiful field , and from the land of Moab ; and I have caused wine to fail from the winepresses : none shall tread with shouting ; \add their\add* shouting \add shall be\add* no shouting.

From the cry of Heshbon \add even\add* unto Elealeh , \add and even\add* unto Jahaz , have they uttered their voice , from Zoar \add even\add* unto Horonaim , \add as\add* an heifer of three years old : for the waters also of Nimrim shall be desolate.\f + \fr 48.34 \ft desolate: Heb. desolations\f*
Moreover I will cause to cease in Moab , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, him that offereth in the high places , and him that burneth incense to his gods.
Therefore mine heart shall sound for Moab like pipes , and mine heart shall sound like pipes for the men of Kir-heres : because the riches \add that\add* he hath gotten are perished.
For every head \add shall be\add* bald , and every beard clipped : upon all the hands \add shall be\add* cuttings , and upon the loins sackcloth.\f + \fr 48.37 \ft clipped: Heb. diminished\f*

\add There shall be\add* lamentation generally upon all the housetops of Moab , and in the streets thereof: for I have broken Moab like a vessel wherein \add is\add* no pleasure , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.

They shall howl , \add saying\add*, How is it broken down ! how hath Moab turned the back with shame ! so shall Moab be a derision and a dismaying to all them about him.\f + \fr 48.39 \ft back: Heb. neck\f*
For thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; Behold, he shall fly as an eagle , and shall spread his wings over Moab.
Kerioth is taken , and the strong holds are surprised , and the mighty men’s hearts in Moab at that day shall be as the heart of a woman in her pangs.\f + \fr 48.41 \ft Kerioth: or, The cities\f*
And Moab shall be destroyed from \add being\add* a people , because he hath magnified \add himself\add* against the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
Fear , and the pit , and the snare , \add shall be\add* upon thee, O inhabitant of Moab , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.

He that fleeth from the fear shall fall into the pit ; and he that getteth up out of the pit shall be taken in the snare : for I will bring upon it, \add even\add* upon Moab , the year of their visitation , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.

They that fled stood under the shadow of Heshbon because of the force : but a fire shall come forth out of Heshbon , and a flame from the midst of Sihon , and shall devour the corner of Moab , and the crown of the head of the tumultuous ones.\f + \fr 48.45 \ft tumultuous…: Heb. children of noise\f*
Woe be unto thee, O Moab ! the people of Chemosh perisheth : for thy sons are taken captives , and thy daughters captives.\f + \fr 48.46 \ft captives, and: Heb. in captivity, etc\f* \p
¶ Yet will I bring again the captivity of Moab in the latter days , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*. Thus far \add is\add* the judgment of Moab.
